markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

elpasotimes.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of The El Paso Times, a newspaper providing news, features, and opinion from the El Paso, Texas, area, and national and international news as part of the USA Today Network.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The El Paso Times and site are owned by Gannett, one of the largest media companies in the United States with more than 100 local news sites.

Content

ElpasoTimes.com publishes news from western Texas and the Texas-Mexico border region on government,  crime, entertainment, business, and sports. Nearly every text story is linked to internally produced video.

The site also links to text and video from the USA Today Network. Sponsored content by advertisers appears online in similar formats to news stories, and is labeled. The site limits online access to a limited number of articles per month for free before charging a subscription fee.

Credibility

Headlines describe stories accurately, and articles are balanced and well-sourced, often from first-hand reporting.

The site refers to the USA Today ethical principles for newsrooms, which indicates it will publish corrections promptly and that it strives to be fair and balanced in its coverage.

El Paso Times staff members were part of the USA Today Network team that won a Pulitzer Prize in 2017 for explanatory reporting on the feasibility and impact of a wall dividing the U.S.-Mexican border. The El Paso Times’ editor and news director, Zahira Torres, was part of the team at the Los Angeles Times that won a 2016 Pulitzer Prize in breaking news for coverage of the San Bernardino shootings.

Transparency

The site is described as being part of the USA Today Network. The site lists phone numbers, titles, and email addresses for staff and general customer service.

Advertisements are either labeled or easily recognizable as graphically distinct from news; most ads appear under a banner with the specific title of “Ad Content.” News and opinion have clearly labeled tabs, and each opinion article is identified as such.

History

The El Paso Times newspaper was founded in 1881. The site registered its domain in 1998.

Written by:
Larry Levin

Edited by:
Amy Westfeldt Eric Effron
